Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above white maeander pattern band between white lines; below, band of alternating red and white petals; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx to left (back with red blobs, under belly, trace of wing, rump, hind leg and tail remaining).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior surface of the sherd was burnt during the bombings in London in 1941.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2006) (phase 2)
